fields.name: 12 South
fields.description: Extremely pedestrian-friendly, the main strip of this neighborhood starts around 12th and Kirkwood Ave, near Sevier Park. This half-mile stretch is home to vintage clothing stores, gourmet restaurants, bakeries, boutiques, and other unique businesses.

fields.name: 5 Points
fields.description: Located within the heart of East Nashville, along Woodland Street and the Cumberland River, this area is home to a culturally diverse and eclectic community, complete with plenty of dive bars, craft cocktail joints, and vintage stores.

fields.name: Berry Hille
fields.description: Located just south of the city, beyond 8th ave, Berry Hill is a flourishing neighborhood best known for its wide-variety of locally-owned funky independent shops, restaurants, recording studios and music publishers occupying many of the homes in this neighborhood.

fields.name: Downtown
fields.description: The energetic hub of Nashville's country music scene, centered along Broadway. Historic buildings have been reimagined into music attractions, boutique hotels, art galleries and, of course, honky tonks.

fields.name: German Town
fields.description: Trendy neighborhood directly north of downtown Nasvhille, Germantown is named for the European immigrants who first settled here in the mid-19th centry. This area is home to the Tennessee State Museum and Bicentennial Capital Mall State Park.

fields.name: Green Hills
fields.description: Located south of downtown and in close proximity to Vanderbilt, Belmont, and Lipscomb, directly south across I-440 from Hillsboro Village, Green Hills is an affluent suburban enclave known for upscale brands, boutiques, and the famed Bluebird Cafe.

fields.name: The Gulch
fields.description: South southwest of downtown, along 11th and 12th Ave, the Gulch was once an abandoned industrial area that's since been revitalized. Now a LEED-certified, highly walkable community, The Gulch is teeming with instagramable murals, live music venues, breweries, and more.

fields.name: Hillsboro Village
fields.description: Tree-lined streets of Wedgewood and 21st Ave, adjacent to the campuses of both Vanderbilt and Belmont Universities. A great location for strolling, Hillsboro Village contains plenty of shops, boutiqes, and restaurants.

fields.name: The Nations
fields.description: One of the oldest neighborhoods in Nashville, The Nations is a former industrial area, complete with abandoned warehouses and mills that have attracted craft breweries, bars, and art galleries to the area.

fields.name: Sylvan Park
fields.description: A quiet neighborhood southwest of downtown, whose locally-owned restaurants, bars, and shops have stood the test of time. The neighborhood's main thoroughfare is Murphy Road, ending at McCabe Park

fields.name: West End
fields.description: Home to the biggest 'urban' park in Nashville, West End is located just south of downtown. Perhaps best known for Centennial Park - home to a full-scale replica of the Green Parthenon. Elliston Place, just up the way, is home to some of the city's best rock clubs.
